context: Tests whether the agent creates a personalized, friendly greeting that uses the user's name and introduces the Tessl ecosystem concepts of tiles and skills.

checklist.name: Uses user's name
checklist.description: The greeting function accepts a name parameter and includes it in the output message

checklist.name: Name in output
checklist.description: The demo script output shows the provided names (e.g. 'Alice', 'Kenji') embedded within the greeting text

checklist.name: Friendly tone
checklist.description: The greeting uses warm/friendly language — contains at least ONE of: 'welcome', 'glad', 'excited', 'happy', 'great to have you', 'hello'

checklist.name: Mentions tiles
checklist.description: The welcome message mentions 'tiles' as a concept

checklist.name: Mentions skills
checklist.description: The welcome message mentions 'skills' as a concept

checklist.name: Mentions Tessl
checklist.description: The welcome message mentions 'Tessl' by name

checklist.name: Ecosystem explanation
checklist.description: The message includes at least one sentence explaining what tiles or skills are or how they relate to each other

checklist.name: Not generic hello
checklist.description: The greeting is NOT just 'Hello <name>' — it contains additional substantive content beyond a one-line greeting

checklist.name: Multiple demo names
checklist.description: The demo script demonstrates the function with at least 2 different names

checklist.name: Warm greeting keyword
checklist.description: The output contains the word 'Hello' or a direct translation greeting word as part of the welcome
